text: Ali Mech was a tribal chief in the 12th century CE, in the region of present- day Assam, India. Belonging to a Mech tribe of the Kachari of Assam, he helped Bakhtiyar Khilji in his failed invasion of Tibet. He is thought to have been the first Muslim convert in Assam. He converted to Islam in 1205 AD. He is considered as the founding father of the Deshi Muslim people of Assam. == References == Category:12th-century rulers in Asia Category:History of Assam Category:Islam in Assam
title: Ali Mech
